 608+ CD13                                      include "./ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm"
# file opened: ././ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm
   1++CD13              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   2++CD13
   3++CD13 00           clipDx                  DB      0           ; also XX12+2
   4++CD14 00           clipDxHigh              DB      0           ; also XX12+3
   5++CD15 00           clipDxHighNonABS        DB      0           ; also XX12+3
   6++CD16 00           clipDy                  DB      0           ; also XX12+4
   7++CD17 00           clipDyHigh              DB      0           ; also XX12+5
   8++CD18 00           clipGradient            DB      0
   9++CD19 00           clipDxySign             DB      0
  10++CD1A              varX12p3                equ     clipDxySign
  11++CD1A 00           clipXGTY                DB      0
  12++CD1B 00           clipFlags               DB      0
  13++CD1C 00           SWAP                    DB      0
  14++CD1D 00 00        varYX                   DW      0
  15++CD1F              ;varRegX                 DB      0
  16++CD1F              ;varXX12p2               DB      0
  17++CD1F 00           clipXX13                 DB      0
  18++CD20
  19++CD20
  20++CD20              ; bounds check and the start to avoid dxy calcs if off screen, eliminating off screens first saves a lot of uncessary mul/div
  21++CD20              ;ClipXX15XX12Line:
  22++CD20 ED 4B 78 C0  ClipLine:               ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)          ; bc - XX15(2,3)
  23++CD24 DD 2A 7C C0                          ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)          ; ix - XX12(0,1)
  24++CD28 2A 76 C0                             ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)          ; hl - XX15(0,1)
  25++CD2B ED 5B 7A C0                          ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)          ; de - XX15(4,5)
  26++CD2F AF                                   xor     a
  27++CD30 32 1C CD                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; SWAP = 0
  28++CD33 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; A = X2Hi
  29++CD34 FD 26 BF     .LL147:                 ld      iyh,$BF                     ; we need to be 191 as its 128 + another bit set from 0 to 6, we are using iyh as regX
  30++CD37                                      ;       push    af
  31++CD37                                      ;       ld      a,iyh
  32++CD37                                      ;       ld      (regX),a
  33++CD37                                      ;       pop     af
  34++CD37 DD B4                                or      ixh                         ; if (X2Hi L-OR Y2 Hi <> 0) goto LL107             -- X2Y2 off screen
  35++CD39 20 0A                                jr      nz, .LL107
  36++CD3B DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  37++CD3D ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; if screen hight < y2 lo, i.e y2 lo >127 goto LL107,
  38++CD40 20 03                                jr      nz,.LL107
  39++CD42 FD 26 00                             ld      iyh, 0                      ; else iyh = regX = 0                                                                        -- X2Y2 on screen
  40++CD45                                      ;        push    af
  41++CD45                                      ;        ld      a,iyh
  42++CD45                                      ;        ld      (regX),a
  43++CD45                                      ;        pop     af
  44++CD45              ; XX13 = regX (i.e. iyh)      ( if XX13 = XX13 is 191 if (x2, y2) is off-screen else 0) we bin XX13 as not needed
  45++CD45              ; so XX13 = 0 if x2_hi = y2_hi = 0, y2_lo is on-screen,  XX13 = 191 if x2_hi or y2_hi are non-zero or y2_lo is off the bottom of the screen
  46++CD45 FD 7C        .LL107                  ld      a,iyh
  47++CD47 32 1F CD                             ld      (clipXX13),a                ; debug copy iyh to xx13
  48++CD4A 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If (X1 hi L-OR Y1) hi  goto LL83                   -- X1Y1 off screen and maybe X2Y2
  49++CD4B B0                                   or      b                           ;
  50++CD4C 20 27                                jr      nz,.LL83                    ;
  51++CD4E 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; or (y1 lo > bottom of screen)
  52++CD4F ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; i.e  screen height < y1)
  53++CD52 20 21                                jr      nz,.LL83
  54++CD54              ; If we get here, (x1, y1) is on-screen
  55++CD54 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh = xx13 at this point if  XX13 <> 0 goto LL108                                                        -- X1Y1 on screen, if we flagged X2Y2 off screen goto LL108
  56++CD56 FE 00                                cp      0
  57++CD58 20 15                                jr      nz, .LL108
  58++CD5A              ; Finished clipping exit point ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  59++CD5A 79           .ClipDone:              ld      a,c                         ; LL146 (Clip Done)               Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
  60++CD5B 32 77 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
  61++CD5E DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  62++CD60 32 79 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
  63++CD63 7D                                   ld      a,l
  64++CD64 32 76 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
  65++CD67 7B                                   ld      a,e
  66++CD68 32 78 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
  67++CD6B                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; carry is clear so valid to plot is in XX15(0to3)
  67++CD6B B7          >				or a
  68++CD6C C9                                   ret                                 ; 2nd pro different, it swops based on swop flag around here.
  69++CD6D              ; Finished out of bounds exit point -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  70++CD6D 37           .PointsOutofBounds:     scf                                 ; LL109 (ClipFailed) carry flag set as not visible
  71++CD6E C9                                   ret
  72++CD6F FD 7C        .LL108:                 ld      a,iyh
  73++CD71 B7                                   or      a
  74++CD72 1F                                   rra
  75++CD73 FD 67                                ld      iyh,a                       ; (X2Y2 Off Screen)         XX13 = 95 (i.e. divide it by 2)                                                 -- X1Y1 on screen X2Y2 off screen
  76++CD75                                      ;        push    af                  ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  77++CD75                                      ;        ld      a,iyh               ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  78++CD75                                      ;        ld      (regX),a            ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  79++CD75                                      ;        pop     af                  ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  80++CD75 FD 7C        .LL83:                  ld      a,iyh                       ; (Line On screen Test)      if XX13 < 128 then only 1 point is on screen so goto LL115                      -- We only need to deal with X2Y2
  81++CD77 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
  82++CD7A 28 28                                jr      z, .LL115                   ;
  83++CD7C 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If both x1_hi and x2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  84++CD7D A2                                   and     d
  85++CD7E                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  85++CD7E FA 6D CD    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  86++CD81 78                                   ld      a,b                         ; If both y1_hi and y2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  87++CD82 DD A4                                and     ixh
  88++CD84                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  88++CD84 FA 6D CD    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  89++CD87 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If neither (x1_hi - 1) or (x2_hi - 1) have bit 7 set, jump to LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C  flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
  90++CD88 3D                                   dec     a
  91++CD89 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a                       ; using iyl as XX12+2 var
  92++CD8B                                      ;        push    af                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  93++CD8B                                      ;        ld      a,iyl              ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  94++CD8B                                      ;        ld      (varXX12p2),a      ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  95++CD8B                                      ;        pop     af                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  96++CD8B 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; a = x2 hi
  97++CD8C 3D                                   dec     a
  98++CD8D FD B5                                or      iyl                         ; (x2 hi -1 ) or (x1 hi -1)
  99++CD8F                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
  99++CD8F F2 6D CD    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
 100++CD92              ;by here we have eliminated -ve Y1 bounds so can just test for positive high and bit 7 of lo
 101++CD92 DD 7C                                ld      a,ixh
 102++CD94 3D                                   dec     a
 103++CD95 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 104++CD97 78                                   ld      a,b
 105++CD98 3D                                   dec     a
 106++CD99 FD B5                                or      iyl
 107++CD9B                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
 107++CD9B F2 6D CD    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
 108++CD9E 79                                   ld      a,c
 109++CD9F DD A5                                and     ixl
 110++CDA1                                      JumpIfNegative .PointsOutofBounds   ; really if both are > 127
 110++CDA1 FA 6D CD    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
 111++CDA4              ; Clip line: calulate the line's gradient
 112++CDA4              ; here as an optimisation we make sure X1 is always < X2  later on
 113++CDA4              .LL115:                 ClearCarryFlag
 113++CDA4 B7          >				or a
 114++CDA5 E5 D5        .CalcDX:                push    hl,,de
 115++CDA7 EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; so hl is x2 and de = x1
 116++CDA8 ED 52                                sbc     hl,de
 117++CDAA                                     ; pop     de                          ; we need de back
 118++CDAA 22 13 CD                             ld      (clipDx),hl
 119++CDAD 7C                                   ld      a,h
 120++CDAE 32 15 CD                             ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a
 121++CDB1                                     ; ld      a,e                         ;a = x2 lo
 122++CDB1                                     ; sbc     a,l                         ;a= a - x1
 123++CDB1                                     ; ld      (clipDx),a
 124++CDB1                                     ; ld      a,d
 125++CDB1                                     ; sbc     a,h
 126++CDB1                                     ; ld      (clipDxHigh),a                ; later we will just move to sub hl,de
 127++CDB1                                     ; ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a          ; it looks liek we need this later post scale loop
 128++CDB1              .CalcDy:                ClearCarryFlag
 128++CDB1 B7          >				or a
 129++CDB2 DD E5 E1                             ld      hl,ix
 130++CDB5 ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc
 131++CDB7 54 5D                                ld      de,hl           ;;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21
 132++CDB9 22 16 CD                             ld      (clipDy),hl     ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 133++CDBC 7C           .CalcQuadrant:          ld      a,h
 134++CDBD                                     ; ld      a,ixl
 135++CDBD                                     ; sbc     c
 136++CDBD                                     ; ld      (clipDy),a
 137++CDBD                                     ; ld      a,ixh
 138++CDBD                                     ; sbc     a,b
 139++CDBD                                     ; ld      (clipDyHigh),a              ; so A = sign of deltay in effect
 140++CDBD                                     ; pop     hl
 141++CDBD
 142++CDBD              ;So we now have delta_x in XX12(3 2), delta_y in XX12(5 4)  where the delta is (x1, y1) - (x2, y2))
 143++CDBD                                    ;  push    hl                          ; Set S = the sign of delta_x * the sign of delta_y, so if bit 7 of S is set, the deltas have different signs
 144++CDBD 21 14 CD                             ld      hl,clipDxHigh
 145++CDC0 AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; now a = sign dx xor sign dy
 146++CDC1 32 CE 92                             ld      (varS),a                    ; DEBGU putting it in var S too for now
 147++CDC4 32 19 CD                             ld      (clipDxySign),a
 148++CDC7 3A 17 CD     .AbsDy:                 ld      a,(clipDyHigh)
 149++CDCA ED 27 80                             test    $80
 150++CDCD 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL110                    ; If delta_y_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 151++CDCF 2A 16 CD                             ld      hl,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 152++CDD2                                      macronegate16de                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 152++CDD2 AF          >					xor 	a
 152++CDD3 93          >                    sub 	e
 152++CDD4 5F          >                    ld 		e,a
 152++CDD5 9F          >                    sbc 	a,a
 152++CDD6 92          >                    sub 	d
 152++CDD7 57          >                    ld 		d,a
 153++CDD8 22 16 CD                             ld      (clipDy),hl                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 154++CDDB 2A 13 CD     .LL110:                 ld      hl,(clipDx)
 155++CDDE 3A 14 CD                             ld      a,(clipDxHigh)
 156++CDE1 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; is it a negative X
 157++CDE4 28 06                                jr      z,.LL111                    ; If delta_x_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 158++CDE6                                      ;ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 159++CDE6                                      macronegate16hl                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 159++CDE6 AF          >					xor 	a
 159++CDE7 95          >					sub 	l
 159++CDE8 6F          >					ld 		l,a
 159++CDE9 9F          >					sbc 	a,a
 159++CDEA 94          >					sub 	h
 159++CDEB 67          >					ld 		h,a
 160++CDEC                                     ; ld      (clipDx),hl                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out; we still retain the old sign in NonABS version
 161++CDEC              .LL111:               ;  push    de
 162++CDEC                                     ; ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 163++CDEC                                     ; ld      de,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 164++CDEC 7C           .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                         ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 165++CDED B2                                   or      d
 166++CDEE 28 0A                                jr      z,.CalculateDelta
 166++CDF0
 167++CDF0                                      ShiftDERight1
 167++CDF0 CB 3A       >			   srl d
 167++CDF2 CB 1B       >			   rr  e
 168++CDF4                                      ShiftHLRight1
 168++CDF4 CB 3C       >			   srl h
 168++CDF6 CB 1D       >			   rr  l
 169++CDF8 18 F2                                jr      .ScaleLoop                  ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been negative
 170++CDFA              .CalculateDelta:        ;ld      (clipDx),hl                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 171++CDFA                                      ;ld      (clipDy),de                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 172++CDFA              ; By now, the high bytes of both |delta_x| and |delta_y| are zero We know that h and d are both = 0 as that's what we tested with a BEQ
 173++CDFA AF           .LL113:                 xor     a
 174++CDFB 32 EC 92                             ld      (varT),a                    ; t = 0
 175++CDFE 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; If delta_x_lo < delta_y_lo, so our line is more vertical than horizontal, jump to LL114
 176++CDFF                                      JumpIfALTNusng  e, .LL114           ;
 176++CDFF BB          >                        cp      e
 176++CE00 DA 10 CE    >                        jp		c,.LL114
 177++CE03              ; Here Dx >= Dy sp calculate Delta Y / delta X
 178++CE03 32 CC 92     .DxGTEDy:               ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = delta_x_lo
 179++CE06 57                                   ld      d,a                         ; d = also Q for calc
 180++CE07 7B                                   ld      a,e                         ; Set A = delta_y_lo
 181++CE08 CD 5F A9                             call    LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate:  R (actually a reg) = 256 * A / Q   = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo
 182++CE0B 32 CD 92                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 183++CE0E 18 10                                jr      .LL116                      ; Jump to LL116, as we now have the line's gradient in R
 184++CE10              ; Here Delta Y > Delta X so calulate delta X / delta Y
 185++CE10 7B           .LL114:                 ld      a,e                         ; Set Q = delta_y_lo
 186++CE11 57                                   ld      d,a
 187++CE12 32 CC 92                             ld      (varQ),a
 188++CE15 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; Set A = delta_x_lo
 189++CE16 CD 5F A9                             call    LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q  = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 190++CE19 32 CD 92                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 191++CE1C 21 EC 92                             ld      hl,varT                     ; T was set to 0 above, so this sets T = &FF
 192++CE1F 35                                   dec     (hl)
 193++CE20 D1           .LL116:                 pop     de                          ; get back X2
 194++CE21 E1                                   pop     hl                          ; get back X1 into hl,
 195++CE22 3A CD 92                             ld      a,(varR)                    ; Store the gradient in XX12+2 this can be optimised later
 196++CE25 32 18 CD                             ld      (clipGradient),a
 197++CE28 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 198++CE2A                                      ;       push    af                   ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 199++CE2A                                      ;       ld      a,iyl                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 200++CE2A                                      ;       ld      (varXX12p2),a        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 201++CE2A                                      ;       pop     af                   ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 202++CE2A 3A CE 92                             ld      a,(varS)
 203++CE2D 32 19 CD                             ld      (clipDxySign),a             ;  Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means ?Not needed as clipDxySign is used for varS earlier?
 204++CE30                                                                          ; top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left **CODE IS WRONG HERE A TEST IS BL to TR
 205++CE30 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh was XX13 from earlier
 206++CE32 FE 00                                cp      0                           ; If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 207++CE34 28 05                                jr      z,.LL138                    ;
 208++CE36 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95. This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump to LLX117 to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
 209++CE39 28 13                                jr      z,.LLX117                   ; coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 210++CE3B              ; If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 211++CE3B CD 62 CE     .LL138                  call    ClipPointHLBC               ; Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 212++CE3E FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 213++CE40 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 214++CE43 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL124
 215++CE45              ; If we get here, XX13 = 191 (both coordinates are off-screen)
 216++CE45 7C           .LL117:                 ld      a,h                         ; If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 217++CE46 B0                                   or      b                           ; LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 218++CE47 C2 6D CD                             jp      nz, .PointsOutofBounds      ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 219++CE4A B1                                   or      c                           ; if x1 and y1 hi are both zero test bit 8 or Y1 to see if its > 128
 220++CE4B FA 6D CD                             jp      m, .PointsOutofBounds       ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 221++CE4E              ; If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing
 222++CE4E              ; the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 223++CE4E EB           .LLX117:                ex      de,hl                       ;  swap X1 and X2
 224++CE4F DD E5                                push    ix                          ;  swap Y1 and Y2
 225++CE51 C5                                   push    bc
 226++CE52 DD E1                                pop     ix
 227++CE54 C1                                   pop     bc
 228++CE55 CD 62 CE                             call    ClipPointHLBC               ;  Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 229++CE58 3A 1C CD                             ld      a,(SWAP)
 230++CE5B 3D                                   dec     a
 231++CE5C 32 1C CD                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 232++CE5F C3 5A CD     .LL124:                 jp      .ClipDone                    ; now put points in place
 233++CE62
 234++CE62              ; Move a point along a line until it is on-screen point is held in HL(X) BC(Y) LL118
 235++CE62              ; iyh still holds XX13 iyl still holds gradient
 236++CE62 7C           ClipPointHLBC:          ld      a,h                         ; If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the following
 237++CE63 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 238++CE66 28 17                                jr      z,.LL119
 239++CE68 32 CE 92     .X1isNegative:          ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 240++CE6B E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 241++CE6E CD E4 CE                             call    LL120                       ;  Call LL120 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 242++CE71                                                                          ;                             (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 243++CE71                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 244++CE71 C1 D1 E1                             pop    hl,,de,,bc                   ;  get coordinates back
 245++CE74 2A 1D CD                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 246++CE77              ;                        ex      hl,de
 247++CE77                                  ;    ld      hl,bc
 248++CE77 09                                   add     hl,bc                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 249++CE78 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl
 250++CE7A 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0                        ; Set x1 = 0
 251++CE7D               ;                       pop     de
 252++CE7D 18 1A                                jr      .LL134                      ; in BBC is set x to 0 to force jump, we will just jump
 253++CE7F FE 00        .LL119:                 cp      0
 254++CE81 28 16                                jr      z,.LL134                    ;  If x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 255++CE83 3D                                   dec     a
 256++CE84 32 CE 92                             ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 257++CE87 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 258++CE8A CD E4 CE                             call    LL120                      ;  Call LL120 to calculate: (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0  = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 259++CE8D                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 260++CE8D                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of theline's direction of slope
 261++CE8D C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 262++CE90                                    ;  push    de                          ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 263++CE90 2A 1D CD                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 264++CE93                                    ; ex      de,hl                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 265++CE93 09                                   add     hl,bc                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 266++CE94 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 267++CE96                                    ; ex      hl,de                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 268++CE96                                    ; ld      hl,bc                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 269++CE96                                    ; add     hl,de                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 270++CE96 21 FF 00                             ld      hl,255                      ; Set x1 = 255
 271++CE99                                    ;  pop     de
 272++CE99              ; We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for they-coordinate
 273++CE99 78           .LL134:                 ld      a,b                         ; If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL135  to skip the following
 274++CE9A ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
 275++CE9D 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL135                    ;
 276++CE9F 32 CE 92                             ld      (varS),a                    ; Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 277++CEA2 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; Set R = y1_lo
 278++CEA3 32 CD 92                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 279++CEA6 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 280++CEA9 CD 0B CF                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 281++CEAC                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 282++CEAC                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 283++CEAC C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 284++CEAF D5                                   push    de
 285++CEB0 EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; de = x1
 286++CEB1 2A 1D CD                             ld      hl,(varYX)                  ; hl = varYX
 287++CEB4 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 288++CEB5 D1                                   pop     de                          ; de = x2 again
 289++CEB6 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                        ; Set y1 = 0
 290++CEB9 79           .LL135:                 ld      a,c                         ; if bc < 128 then no work to do
 291++CEBA E6 80                                and     $80
 292++CEBC B0                                   or      b                           ; here we see if c bit 8 is set or anything in b as we know if its 0 this would mean there is no need to clip
 293++CEBD C8                                   ret     z
 294++CEBE E5                                   push    hl
 295++CEBF 60 69                                ld      hl,bc
 296++CEC1 01 80 00                             ld      bc,128
 297++CEC4 B7                                   or      a
 298++CEC5 ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc                       ; hl =  (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - 128
 299++CEC7 22 CD 92                             ld      (varRS), hl                 ; and now RS (or SR)
 300++CECA 7C                                   ld      a,h
 301++CECB E1                                   pop     hl
 302++CECC ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < 192, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136 to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 303++CECF C0                                   ret     nz
 304++CED0              ; If we get here then y1 >= 192, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 305++CED0 E5 D5 C5     .LL139:                 push    hl,,de,,bc
 306++CED3 CD 0B CF                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 307++CED6                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 308++CED6                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 309++CED6 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 310++CED9 D5                                   push    de
 311++CEDA EB                                   ex      hl,de
 312++CEDB 2A 1D CD                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 313++CEDE 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 314++CEDF 01 7F 00                             ld      bc,127                      ; set bc to 127 bottom of screen
 315++CEE2 D1                                   pop     de
 316++CEE3 C9           .LL136:                 ret                                 ;  Return from the subroutine
 317++CEE4
 318++CEE4
 319++CEE4              ; Calculate the following:   * If T = 0  (more vertical than horizontal), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 320++CEE4              ;                            * If T <> 0 (more horizontal than vertical), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 321++CEE4              ;                              giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 322++CEE4              ; Other entry points        LL122                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) * Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 323++CEE4 7D           LL120:                  ld      a,l                          ; Set R = x1_lo
 324++CEE5 32 CD 92                             ld      (varR),a
 325++CEE8 CD 53 CF                             call    LL129                        ;  Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 326++CEEB F5                                   push    af                           ;  Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 327++CEEC C5                                   push    bc
 328++CEED 47                                   ld      b,a
 329++CEEE 3A EC 92                             ld      a,(varT)                     ; instead : (Y X) = (S R ) / Q
 330++CEF1 FE 00                                cp      0
 331++CEF3 78                                   ld      a,b
 332++CEF4 C1                                   pop     bc                           ; we can't use af as that would disrupt the flags
 333++CEF5 20 23                                jr      nz, LL121
 334++CEF7              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 335++CEF7 3A 18 CD     LL122:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 336++CEFA 32 CC 92                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 337++CEFD CD 6F 9F                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 338++CF00 22 1D CD                             ld      (varYX),hl
 339++CF03 F1                                   pop     af
 340++CF04 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 341++CF07 CA 46 CF                             jp      z,LL133
 342++CF0A C9                                   ret
 343++CF0B              ; Calculate the following: * If T = 0,  calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (actually SR & XX12+2 /256)
 344++CF0B              ;                          * If T <> 0, calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
 345++CF0B              ;                          giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 346++CF0B              ;
 347++CF0B              ; Other entry points:      LL121                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) / Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 348++CF0B              ;                          LL133                Negate (Y X) and return from the subroutine
 349++CF0B              ;                          LL128                Contains an RTS
 350++CF0B CD 53 CF     LL123:                  call    LL129                       ; Call LL129 to do the following: Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 351++CF0E F5                                   push    af                          ; Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 352++CF0F C5                                   push    bc                          ; If T is non-zero, so it's more horizontal than vertical, jump down to LL121 to calculate this
 353++CF10 47                                   ld      b,a
 354++CF11 3A EC 92                             ld      a,(varT)                    ; instead : (Y X) = (S R) * Q *** this looks to be the wrong way roudn for Y!!!!
 355++CF14 FE 00                                cp      0
 356++CF16 78                                   ld      a,b
 357++CF17 C1                                   pop     bc
 358++CF18 20 DD                                jr      nz, LL122
 359++CF1A              ; The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2, its actually X.Y=R.S*256/Q
 360++CF1A 11 FE FF     LL121:                  ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 361++CF1D 2A CD 92                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 362++CF20 3A CC 92                             ld      a,(varQ)
 363++CF23 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 364++CF24              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 364++CF24 CB 25       >			   sla l
 364++CF26 CB 14       >			   rl  h
 365++CF28 7C                                   ld      a,h
 366++CF29 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 367++CF2B                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 367++CF2B B8          >                        cp      b
 367++CF2C DA 37 CF    >                        jp		c,.LL132
 368++CF2F 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 369++CF30 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 370++CF31 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 371++CF32 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 372++CF33 DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 373++CF35 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 374++CF36 3F                                   ccf
 375++CF37              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 375++CF37 CB 13       >               rl  e
 375++CF39 CB 12       >               rl   d
 376++CF3B 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 377++CF3D ED 53 1D CD                          ld      (varYX),de
 378++CF41 F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 379++CF42 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 380++CF45 C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 381++CF46 2A 1D CD     LL133:                  ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 382++CF49                                      NegHL
 382++CF49 AF          >                xor a
 382++CF4A 95          >                sub l
 382++CF4B 6F          >                ld l,a
 382++CF4C 9F          >                sbc a,a
 382++CF4D 94          >                sub h
 382++CF4E 67          >                ld h,a
 383++CF4F 22 1D CD                             ld      (varYX),hl
 384++CF52 C9           LL128:                  ret
 385++CF53              ; Do the following, in this order:  Q = XX12+2
 386++CF53              ;                                   A = S EOR XX12+3
 387++CF53              ;                                   (S R) = |S R|
 388++CF53              ; This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 389++CF53 3A 18 CD     LL129:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 390++CF56 32 CC 92                             ld      (varQ),a                    ;Set Q = XX12+2
 391++CF59 3A CE 92                             ld      a,(varS)                    ; If S is positive, jump to LL127
 392++CF5C E5 F5                                push    hl,,af
 393++CF5E ED 27 80                             test    $80
 394++CF61 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL127
 395++CF63 2A CD 92                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; else SR = | SR|
 396++CF66                                      NegHL
 396++CF66 AF          >                xor a
 396++CF67 95          >                sub l
 396++CF68 6F          >                ld l,a
 396++CF69 9F          >                sbc a,a
 396++CF6A 94          >                sub h
 396++CF6B 67          >                ld h,a
 397++CF6C 22 CD 92                             ld      (varRS),hl
 398++CF6F 21 19 CD     .LL127:                 ld      hl,clipDxySign
 399++CF72 F1                                   pop     af
 400++CF73 AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; a = S XOR clipDxySign
 401++CF74 E1                                   pop     hl
 402++CF75 C9                                   ret
 403++CF76
# file closed: ././ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm

   1++CF76              ; Set TransMatTo

   3++CF76              ; XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10) = roofv_x roofv_y roofv_z XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10)

 625+ CFC1 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; else do explosion needs all vertices                                                  ;;;

 647+ CFE4
 648+ CFE4              ;;;;X = normal scale
 649+ CFE4              ;;;;ZtempHi = zhi
 650+ CFE4              ;;;;......................................................
 651+ CFE4              ;;;; if ztemp hi <> 0                                   ::Scale Object Distance
 652+ CFE4              ;;;;  Loop                                              ::LL90
 653+ CFE4              ;;;;     inc X
 654+ CFE4              ;;;;     divide X, Y & ZtempHiLo by 2
 655+ CFE4              ;;;;  Until ZtempHi = 0
 656+ CFE4              ;;;;......................................................
 657+ CFE4              ;-LL21---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 658+ CFE4                                      include "Universe/NormaliseTransMat.asm"
# file opened: ./Universe/NormaliseTransMat.asm
   1++CFE4              ;divdide by 16 using undocumented instrunctions
   2++CFE4              Norm256mulAdivQ:
   3++CFE4 47               ld      b,a
   4++CFE5 0E 00            ld      c,0
   5++CFE7 16 00            ld      d,0
   6++CFE9 3A CC 92         ld      a,(varQ)
   7++CFEC 5F               ld      e,a
   8++CFED              ;Input: BC = Dividend, DE = Divisor, HL = 0
   9++CFED              ;Output: BC = Quotient, HL = Remainder
  10++CFED              NormDIV16UNDOC:
  11++CFED 21 00 00         ld      hl,0
  12++CFF0 78               ld      a,b
  13++CFF1 06 10            ld      b,16
  14++CFF3              NormDIV16UNDOCLOOP:
  15++CFF3 CB 31        	sll	    c		; unroll 16 times
  16++CFF5 17           	rla	    		; ...
  17++CFF6 ED 6A        	adc	    hl,hl		; ...
  18++CFF8 ED 52        	sbc	    hl,de		; ...
  19++CFFA 30 02        	jr	    nc,NormDIV16UNDOCSKIP		; ...
  20++CFFC 19           	add	    hl,de		; ...
  21++CFFD 0D           	dec	    c		; ...
  22++CFFE              NormDIV16UNDOCSKIP:
  23++CFFE 10 F3            djnz    NormDIV16UNDOCLOOP
  24++D000 79               ld      a,c
  25++D001 32 CD 92         ld      (varR),a
  26++D004 C9               ret
  27++D005
  28++D005              ; Tested OK
  29++D005              NormaliseTransMat:
  30++D005              ;LL21
  31++D005 21 42 C0             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatNosevZ+1         ; initialise loop
  32++D008 0E C5                ld      c,ConstNorm                 ; c = Q = norm = 197
  33++D00A 79                   ld      a,c
  34++D00B 32 CC 92             ld      (varQ),a                    ; set up varQ
  35++D00E 06 09                ld      b,9                         ; total of 9 elements to transform
  36++D010              LL21Loop:
  37++D010 56                   ld      d,(hl)
  38++D011 2B                   dec     hl
  39++D012 5E                   ld      e,(hl)                      ; de = hilo now   hl now = pointer to low byte
  40++D013                      ShiftDELeft1                        ; De = DE * 2
  40++D013 CB 23       >			   sla e
  40++D015 CB 12       >			   rl  d
  41++D017 7A                   ld      a,d                         ; a = hi byte after shifting
  42++D018 E5           		push	hl
  43++D019 C5           		push	bc
  44++D01A CD E4 CF             call    Norm256mulAdivQ
  45++D01D              		;===call    RequAmul256divC				; R = (2(hi).0)/ConstNorm - LL28 Optimised BFRDIV R=A*256/Q = delta_y / delta_x Use Y/X grad. as not steep
  46++D01D 79                   ld      a,c                         ; BFRDIV returns R also in l reg
  47++D01E C1           		pop		bc
  48++D01F E1           		pop		hl							; bc gets wrecked by BFRDIV
  49++D020 77                   ld      (hl),a                      ; write low result to low byte so zlo = (zhl *2)/197, we keep hi byte in tact as we need the sign bit
  50++D021 2B                   dec     hl                          ; now hl = hi byte of pre val e.g z->y->x
  51++D022 10 EC                djnz    LL21Loop                    ; loop from 2zLo through to 0xLo
  52++D024 C9                   ret
  53++D025
# file closed: ./Universe/NormaliseTransMat.asm

 667+ D025                                      include "Universe/InverseXX16.asm"
# file opened: ./Universe/InverseXX16.asm
   1++D025              ; TESTEDOK
   2++D025
   3++D025              ;ScaleOrientationXX16:                       ; DEBUG TODO will combine with inverse later
   4++D025              ;        ld      a,(XX17)
   5++D025              ;        ld      ixl,a
   6++D025              ;        ld      ixh,9
   7++D025              ;        ld      hl,UBnkTransInv0x

   9++D025              ;ScaleNode:
  10++D025              ;        ld      b,ixl
  11++D025              ;ScaleNodeLoop:

  13++D025              ;        djnz    ScaleNodeLoop
  14++D025              ;        ld      (hl),a

  21++D025
  22++D025              InverseXX16:								; lead routine into .LL42	\ ->  &4B04 \ DO nodeX-Ycoords their comment  \  TrnspMat
  23++D025              ; we coudl combine this with move to transmat later as an optimisation
  24++D025              ; INPUT - All Scaled
  25++D025              ;  They transmat has already been put into side, roof nose order
  26++D025              ;  XX16   = |sidev_x| |sidev_y| |sidev_z|  1  0  3  2  5  4 note each bytepair is Scaled value in low and high byte just for sign
  27++D025              ;  XX16   = |roofv_x| |roofv_y| |roofv_z|  7  6  8  9 11 10
  28++D025              ;  XX16   = |nosev_x| |nosev_y| |nosev_z| 13 12 15 14 17 16
  29++D025              ; OUTPUT
  30++D025              ;  XX16(1 0)   ( 3 2) ( 5 4 ) =  sidev_x roofv_x nosev_x
  31++D025              ;  XX16(7 6)   ( 8 9) (11 10) =  sidev_y roofv_y nosev_y
  32++D025              ;  XX16(13 12) (15 14)(17 16) =  sidev_z roofv_z nosev_z
  33++D025              ; First all side values become compoment 0 of each vector
  34++D025 2A 31 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevX)     ;
  35++D028 ED 5B 37 C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvX)     ;
  36++D02C ED 4B 3D C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevX)     ;
  37++D030 22 49 C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x0),hl     ;
  38++D033 ED 53 4B C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x1),de     ;
  39++D037 ED 43 4D C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x2),bc     ;
  40++D03B 2A 33 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevY)     ;
  41++D03E ED 5B 39 C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvY)     ;
  42++D042 ED 4B 3F C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevY)     ;
  43++D046 22 51 C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y0),hl     ;
  44++D049 ED 53 53 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y1),de     ;
  45++D04D ED 43 55 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y2),bc     ;
  46++D051 2A 35 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevZ)     ;
  47++D054 ED 5B 3B C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvZ)     ;
  48++D058 ED 4B 41 C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevZ)     ;
  49++D05C 22 59 C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z0),hl     ;
  50++D05F ED 53 5B C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z1),de     ;
  51++D063 ED 43 5D C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z2),bc     ;
  52++D067 C9                   ret
  53++D068
  54++D068
# file closed: ./Universe/InverseXX16.asm
 668+ D068              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 669+ D068              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 670+ D068              ;   XX12(1 0) = [x y z] . sidev  = (dot_sidev_sign dot_sidev_lo)  = dot_sidev
 671+ D068              ;   XX12(3 2) = [x y z] . roofv  = (dot_roofv_sign dot_roofv_lo)  = dot_roofv
 672+ D068              ;   XX12(5 4) = [x y z] . nosev  = (dot_nosev_sign dot_nosev_lo)  = dot_nosev
 673+ D068              ; Returns
 674+ D068              ;
 675+ D068              ;   XX12(1 0)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the sidev (or _x)
 676+ D068              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+1 and magnitude in XX12
 677+ D068              ;
 678+ D068              ;   XX12(3 2)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the roofv (or _y)
 679+ D068              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+3 and magnitude in XX12+2
 680+ D068              ;
 681+ D068              ;   XX12(5 4)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the nosev (or _z)
 682+ D068              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+5 and magnitude in XX12+4
 683+ D068              XXCURRENTN0equN1byN2div256: MACRO param1, param2, param3
 684+ D068 ~                                    ld      c,0
 685+ D068 ~                                    ld      a,param3                      ;
 686+ D068 ~                                    bit     7,a
 687+ D068 ~                                    jr      z,.val2Pos
 688+ D068 ~            ;HandleSignebits
 689+ D068 ~                                    neg
 690+ D068 ~                                    ld      c,$80
 691+ D068 ~            .val2Pos:               ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 692+ D068 ~                                    ld      a,param2                        ; A = XX16 element
 693+ D068 ~                                    bit     7,a
 694+ D068 ~                                    jr      z,.val1Pos
 695+ D068 ~            ;HandleSignebits
 696+ D068 ~                                    neg
 697+ D068 ~                                    ld      b,a
 698+ D068 ~                                    ld      a,c
 699+ D068 ~                                    xor     $80
 700+ D068 ~                                    ld      c,a
 701+ D068 ~                                    ld      a,b
 702+ D068 ~            .val1Pos:               ld      d,a
 703+ D068 ~            ;AequAmulQdiv256:
 704+ D068 ~                                    mul
 705+ D068 ~                                    ld      a,c
 706+ D068 ~                                    bit     7,a
 707+ D068 ~                                    ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 708+ D068 ~                                    jr      z,.resultPos
 709+ D068 ~                                    neg
 710+ D068 ~            .resultPos:             ld      (param1),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 711+ D068                                      ENDM
 712+ D068
 713+ D068              AequN1xorN2:            MACRO  param1,param2
 714+ D068 ~                                    ld      a,(param1)
 715+ D068 ~                                    xor     param2
 716+ D068                                      ENDM
 717+ D068
 718+ D068              N0equN1byN2div256:      MACRO param1,param2,param3
 719+ D068 ~                                    ld      a,param3                        ;
 720+ D068 ~                                    ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 721+ D068 ~                                    ld      a,param2                        ; A = XX16 element
 722+ D068 ~                                    ld      d,a
 723+ D068 ~                                    mul
 724+ D068 ~                                    ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 725+ D068 ~                                    ld      (param1),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 726+ D068                                      ENDM
 727+ D068
 728+ D068               ; TESTEDOK
 729+ D068              XX12DotOneRow:
 730+ D068              XX12CalcX:              N0equN1byN2div256 varT, (hl), (UBnkXScaled)       ; T = (hl) * regXX15fx /256
 730+ D068 3A 76 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkXScaled)                        ;
 730+ D06B 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 730+ D06C 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 730+ D06D 57          >                        ld      d,a
 730+ D06E ED 30       >                        mul
 730+ D070 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 730+ D071 32 EC 92    >                        ld      (varT),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 731+ D074 23                                   inc     hl                                  ; move to sign byte
 732+ D075              XX12CalcXSign:          AequN1xorN2 UBnkXScaledSign,(hl)             ;
 732+ D075 3A 77 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkXScaledSign)
 732+ D078 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 733+ D079 32 CE 92                             ld      (varS),a                            ; Set S to the sign of x_sign * sidev_x
 734+ D07C 23                                   inc     hl
 735+ D07D              XX12CalcY:              N0equN1byN2div256 varQ, (hl),(UBnkYScaled)       ; Q = XX16 * XX15 /256 using varQ to hold regXX15fx
 735+ D07D 3A 78 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkYScaled)                        ;
 735+ D080 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 735+ D081 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 735+ D082 57          >                        ld      d,a
 735+ D083 ED 30       >                        mul
 735+ D085 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 735+ D086 32 CC 92    >                        ld      (varQ),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 736+ D089                                      ldCopyByte varT,varR                        ; R = T =  |sidev_x| * x_lo / 256
 736+ D089 3A EC 92    >               ld       a,(varT)
 736+ D08C 32 CD 92    >               ld       (varR),a
 737+ D08F 23                                   inc     hl
 738+ D090                                      AequN1xorN2 UBnkYScaledSign,(hl)             ; Set A to the sign of y_sign * sidev_y
 738+ D090 3A 79 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkYScaledSign)
 738+ D093 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 739+ D094              ; (S)A = |sidev_x| * x_lo / 256  = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 740+ D094 E5           STequSRplusAQ           push    hl
 741+ D095 CD 1E A6                             call    baddll38                            ; JSR &4812 \ LL38   \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA) \ 1byte add (subtract)
 742+ D098 E1                                   pop     hl
 743+ D099 32 EC 92                             ld      (varT),a                            ; T = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 744+ D09C 23                                   inc     hl
 745+ D09D              XX12CalcZ:              N0equN1byN2div256 varQ,(hl),(UBnkZScaled)       ; Q = |sidev_z| * z_lo / 256
 745+ D09D 3A 7A C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkZScaled)                        ;
 745+ D0A0 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 745+ D0A1 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 745+ D0A2 57          >                        ld      d,a
 745+ D0A3 ED 30       >                        mul
 745+ D0A5 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 745+ D0A6 32 CC 92    >                        ld      (varQ),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 746+ D0A9                                      ldCopyByte varT,varR                        ; R = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 746+ D0A9 3A EC 92    >               ld       a,(varT)
 746+ D0AC 32 CD 92    >               ld       (varR),a
 747+ D0AF 23                                   inc     hl
 748+ D0B0                                      AequN1xorN2 UBnkZScaledSign,(hl)             ; A = sign of z_sign * sidev_z
 748+ D0B0 3A 7B C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkZScaledSign)
 748+ D0B3 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 749+ D0B4              ; (S)A= |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo + |sidev_z| * z_lo
 750+ D0B4 CD 1E A6                             call    baddll38                            ; JSR &4812 \ LL38   \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA)   \ 1byte add (subtract)
 751+ D0B7              ; Now we exit with A = result S = Sign
 752+ D0B7 C9                                   ret
 753+ D0B8
 754+ D0B8              ; added where sign is separate byte
 755+ D0B8              ;;;XX12DotOneRowV2:
 756+ D0B8              ;;;XX12CalcXV2:
 757+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      a,(hl)
 758+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      de,(UBnkXScaled)
 759+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      b,d
 760+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      d,a
 761+ D0B8              ;;;        mul
 762+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      a,e
 763+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      (varT),a
 764+ D0B8              ;;;XX12CalcXSignV2:
 765+ D0B8              ;;;        inc     hl
 766+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      a,(hl)
 767+ D0B8              ;;;        xor     b
 768+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      (varS),a
 769+ D0B8              ;;;XX12CalcYV2:
 770+ D0B8              ;;;        inc     hl
 771+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      de,(UBnkYScaled)
 772+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      b,d
 773+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      d,a
 774+ D0B8              ;;;        mul
 775+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      a,e
 776+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      (varQ),a
 777+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      a,(varT)
 778+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      (varR),a
 779+ D0B8              ;;;XX12CalcYSignV2:
 780+ D0B8              ;;;        inc     hl
 781+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      a,(hl)
 782+ D0B8              ;;;        xor     b
 783+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      (varS),a
 784+ D0B8              ;;;XX12CalcXPlusYV2:
 785+ D0B8              ;;;        push    hl
 786+ D0B8              ;;;        call    baddll38                            ; JSR &4812 \ LL38   \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA) \ 1byte add (subtract)
 787+ D0B8              ;;;        pop     hl
 788+ D0B8              ;;;        ld      (varT),a                            ; var S already holds sign
 789+ D0B8              ;;;       ret
 790+ D0B8
 791+ D0B8
 792+ D0B8              ;-- LL51---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 793+ D0B8              ;TESTED OK
 794+ D0B8              XX12EquXX15DotProductXX16:
 795+ D0B8              XX12EquScaleDotOrientation:                         ; .LL51 \ -> &4832 \ XX12=XX15.XX16  each vector is 16-bit x,y,z
 796+ D0B8 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                                ; LDX, LDY 0
 797+ D0BB 21 31 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatSidevX
 798+ D0BE CD 68 D0                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 799+ D0C1 32 7C C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12xLo),a
 800+ D0C4 3A CE 92                             ld      a,(varS)
 801+ D0C7 32 7D C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12xSign),a
 802+ D0CA 21 37 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatRoofvX
 803+ D0CD CD 68 D0                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 804+ D0D0 32 7E C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12yLo),a
 805+ D0D3 3A CE 92                             ld      a,(varS)
 806+ D0D6 32 7F C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12ySign),a
 807+ D0D9 21 3D C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatNosevX
 808+ D0DC CD 68 D0                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 809+ D0DF 32 80 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12zLo),a
 810+ D0E2 3A CE 92                             ld      a,(varS)
 811+ D0E5 32 81 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12zSign),a
 812+ D0E8 C9                                   ret
 813+ D0E9              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 814+ D0E9                                      include "./Variables/CopyXX12ScaledToXX18.asm"

  45++D1DD              XX15EquXX15AddXX18:
  46++D1DD              LL94Z:
  47++D1DD 26 00                ld      h,0                                                     ;           AddZ = FaceData (XX12)z +  ShipPos (XX18)z
  48++D1DF 16 00                ld      d,0                                                     ;
  49++D1E1 3A 7A C0             ld      a,(UBnkZScaled)                                         ;
  50++D1E4 6F                   ld      l,a                                                     ;
  51++D1E5 3A 7B C0             ld      a,(UBnkZScaledSign)                                     ;
  52++D1E8 47                   ld      b,a                                                     ;
  53++D1E9 3A 70 C0             ld      a,(UBnkDrawCam0zLo)                                     ;
  54++D1EC 5F                   ld      e,a                                                     ;
  55++D1ED 3A 72 C0             ld      a,(UBnkDrawCam0zSgn)                                    ;
  56++D1F0 4F                   ld      c,a                                                     ;
  57++D1F1 CD 3E CB             call    ADDHLDESignBC                                           ;
  58++D1F4 47                   ld      b,a                                                     ;
  59++D1F5 7C                   ld      a,h                                                     ;
  60++D1F6 78                   ld      a,b                                                     ;           else  Scaled (XX15) Z = AddZ
  61++D1F7 32 7B C0             ld      (UBnkZScaledSign),a                                     ;
  62++D1FA 7D                   ld      a,l                                                     ;
  63++D1FB 32 7A C0             ld      (UBnkZScaled),a                                         ;           endif
  64++D1FE              LL94X:
  65++D1FE 26 00                ld      h,0                                                     ;           AddZ = FaceData (XX12)z +  ShipPos (XX18)z
  66++D200 16 00                ld      d,0                                                     ;
  67++D202 3A 76 C0             ld      a,(UBnkXScaled)                                         ;
  68++D205 6F                   ld      l,a                                                     ;
  69++D206 3A 77 C0             ld      a,(UBnkXScaledSign)                                     ;
  70++D209 47                   ld      b,a                                                     ;
  71++D20A 3A 6A C0             ld      a,(UBnkDrawCam0xLo)                                     ;
  72++D20D 5F                   ld      e,a                                                     ;
  73++D20E 3A 6C C0             ld      a,(UBnkDrawCam0xSgn)                                    ;
  74++D211 4F                   ld      c,a                                                     ;
  75++D212 CD 3E CB             call    ADDHLDESignBC                                           ;
  76++D215 47                   ld      b,a                                                     ;
  77++D216 7C                   ld      a,h                                                     ;
  78++D217 78                   ld      a,b                                                     ;           else  Scaled (XX15) Z = AddZ
  79++D218 32 77 C0             ld      (UBnkXScaledSign),a                                     ;
  80++D21B 7D                   ld      a,l                                                     ;
  81++D21C 32 76 C0             ld      (UBnkXScaled),a                                         ;           endif
  82++D21F              LL94Y:
  83++D21F 26 00                ld      h,0                                                     ;           AddZ = FaceData (XX12)z +  ShipPos (XX18)z
  84++D221 16 00                ld      d,0                                                     ;
  85++D223 3A 78 C0             ld      a,(UBnkYScaled)                                         ;
  86++D226 6F                   ld      l,a                                                     ;
  87++D227 3A 79 C0             ld      a,(UBnkYScaledSign)                                     ;
  88++D22A 47                   ld      b,a                                                     ;
  89++D22B 3A 6D C0             ld      a,(UBnkDrawCam0yLo)                                     ;
  90++D22E 5F                   ld      e,a                                                     ;
  91++D22F 3A 6F C0             ld      a,(UBnkDrawCam0ySgn)                                    ;
  92++D232 4F                   ld      c,a                                                     ;
  93++D233 CD 3E CB             call    ADDHLDESignBC                                           ;
  94++D236 47                   ld      b,a                                                     ;
  95++D237 7C                   ld      a,h                                                     ;
  96++D238 78                   ld      a,b                                                     ;           else  Scaled (XX15) Z = AddZ
  97++D239 32 79 C0             ld      (UBnkYScaledSign),a                                     ;
  98++D23C 7D                   ld      a,l                                                     ;
  99++D23D 32 78 C0             ld      (UBnkYScaled),a                                         ;
 100++D240 C9                   ret
